core package

Module contents

Core Package

This package contains all the objects required for the simulation. This is where you add new Xray sources if testing different sources. You could add new Gamma sources, but you would probably have to develop a new method to find_hits in the simulation submodule.

Modules:

  • gamma: The Gamma pulse

  • simulation: The Monte Carlo simulation

  • xray: The Xray source

  • xray_lambertian: A lambertian xray source

  • xray_lambertian_Ge: Germanium lambertian xray source

  • xray_lambertian_Pd: Palladium lambertian xray source

  • xray_line: Line Xray source

  • xray_line_twave: Line Xray source generated by a travelling wave

core.gamma module

Defines the class Gamma, representing a gamma pulse in the simulation. This class provides geometric properties and methods to change its dimensions and position. Also includes matplotlib integration through patches.

class core.gamma.Gamma(x_pos: float, pulse_length: float, height: float, off_axis_dist: float, facecolor=(0, 0, 1, 0.5), edgecolor=(1, 0, 0), linewidth=2)[source]

Bases: object

Gamma pulse parameters and axes object

x_pos

x-coordinate of gamma pulse (left edge of rectangle) (mm)

Type:

float

pulse_length

length of gamma pulse (mm)

Type:

float

height

height of gamma pulse in 2D, for an azimuthal angle of 0, this corresponds to the radius (mm)

Type:

float

off_axis_dist

perpendicular distance from bottom of gamma pulse to x-ray source when directly over head (mm)

Type:

float

facecolor

face colour of axes object. Defaults to (0, 0, 1, 0.5).

Type:

tuple, optional

edgecolor

edge colour of axes object. Defaults to (1, 0, 0).

Type:

tuple, optional

linewidth

line width of axes object. Defaults to 2.

Type:

int, optional

core.simulation module

Defines the class simulation, which simulates the interaction between the Xray bath and Gamma pulse using a Monte Carlo method. Performs basic simulation tasks such as predicting hits, detecting hits, and plotting. Designed as a subclass to more in-depth simulation tasks such as visualisation and estimating positron pairs produced

class core.simulation.Simulation(xray_bath: Xray, gamma_pulse: Gamma)[source]

Bases: object

Simulation of X-ray bath and gamma pulse interactions (hits)

Type:

gamma_pulse

Type:

find_hits(eff_height: float = None, eff_d: float = None) → tuple[source]

Calculate hits using X-ray seed coordinates Check future position and see if registers a hit

Parameters:

  • eff_height (float, optional) – effective height if on an off-azimuthal position. Defaults to None

  • eff_d (float, optional) – effective off-axis displacement. Defaults to None

Returns:

Tuple containing:

  • float: number of ovelaps

  • list[list[float]]: list of coordinates of overlaps in the form [time, x, y, angle]

Return type:

tuple[float, list[list[float]]]

core.xray module

Defines the class Xray, representing the Xray bath in the simulation. Does so by sampling a radially-uniform, gaussian travelling profile. This class provides attributes and methods for sampling, generating, and moving the sampled ‘Xray photons’. Designed to be subclassed by other distribution types for Xray modelling such as ‘XrayLambertian’ and ‘XrayLine’

class core.xray.Xray(fwhm: float, rotation=0, n_samples_angular=400, n_samples=10)[source]

Bases: object

Coordinates and distribution of the X-ray bath

fwhm

Full-Width-Half-Maximum of the X-ray distribution (mm)

Type:

float

Variance

Variance of the X-ray distribution (mm^2)

Type:

float

gen_xray_seed(mean, variance, **kwargs) → list[source]

Generates distribution of X ray pulse in 2D

Parameters:

  • mean (float) – mean of distribution, radial position (m)

  • variance (float) – variance of x-ray distribution (mm^2)

  • **kwargs – optional keyword arguments. rotation (float, optional): rotation of the Xray source or the kapton tape angle (rad). Defaults to 0. n_samples_angular (int, optional): Number of angles to sample. Defaults to 400. n_samples (int, optional): Number of samples per angle. Defaults to 10.

Returns:

numpy array containing:

  • coordinates for distribution points in the form [x, y, angle].

The angle is to the x-axis in the plane of the gamma pulse’s motion

Return type:

numpy.ndarray[list[float]]

core.xray_lambertian module

Defines the XrayLambertian class which inherits from the Xray class. Represents a Lambertian disturibution of Xrays, I = I0cosx. This class redefines the Xray coordinate generation and method for obtaining the total number of samples taken.

class core.xray_lambertian.XrayLambertian(fwhm: float, rotation=0, n_samples_angular=400, n_samples=10)[source]

Bases: Xray

Coordinates and distribution of the X-ray bath Inherits from the Xray bath class Uses a lambertian distribution for points instead

Overridden methods:
gen_xray_seed(mean: float, variance: float, **kwargs: float) -> numpy.ndarray:

Generates Xray coordinates sampled from a lambertian, gaussian profile.

get_n_samples_total() -> int: Returns the total number of Xray coordinates generated

appropriate for a lambertian distribution.

gen_xray_seed(mean: float, variance: float, **kwargs)[source]

Generates a lambertian distribution of X ray pulse in 2D

Parameters:

  • mean (float) – mean of distribution, radial position (m)

  • variance (float) – variance of x-ray distribution (mm^2)

  • **kwargs – optional keyword arguments. rotation (float, optional): rotation of the Xray source or the kapton tape angle (rad). Defaults to 0, n_samples_angular (int, optional): Number of angles to sample. Defaults to 400. n_samples (int, optional): Number of samples per angle. Defaults to 10. get_n_lambert (bool, optional): If True, returns the number of generated samples along with the coordinates. Defaults to False.

Returns:

list of coordinates for distribution points int (conditional): number of samples taken

Return type:

np.ndarray[list[float]]

get_n_samples_total() → int[source]

Access method for n_samples_total

Returns:

total number of xray coordinates generated

Return type:

int

phi (float) – _description_

core.xray_lambertian_Ge module

Defines a Lambertian Xray source Characteristic of a Germanium source. cos^0.4(x) (Cary Colgan PhD)

core.xray_line module

Defines the XrayLine class which inherits from the XrayLambertian class. Represents a line source’s Xray emissions, done so by placing multiple point-Lambertian sources along its length.

class core.xray_line.XrayLine(fwhm: float, line_length: float, rotation=0, n_samples_angular=400, n_samples=10, n_line_samples=10)[source]

Bases: XrayLambertian

Generates a line source by setting up an array of lambertian point sources. This class extends ‘XrayLambertian’.

line_length

Total physical length of the X-ray line source (mm).

Type:

float

n_line_samples

Number of discrete Lambertian emitters along the line.

Type:

int

xray_coords

2D array of sampled ray coordinates (overridden).

Type:

list

n_samples_total

Total number of Xray photons generated (overridden).

Type:

int

Overridden Methods:
resample(azimuthal_angle: float):

Resamples Xrays based on azimuthal orientation.

get_n_samples_total() -> int:

Returns total number of Xrays photons generated.

New Methods:
gen_xray_seed_line(azimuthal_angle: float) -> tuple[list, int(conditional)]:

Initializes the Xray coordinates by seeding each point source along the line.

gen_xray_seed_line(phi=0, get_total_samples=False) → tuple[source]

Generates xray coordinates for a line source

Returns:

A tuple containing

  • list: array of line-source-generated xray coordinates

  • int(conditional): the total number of xray points

Return type:

tuple[list, int]

Resamples x-ray distribution

core.xray_line_twave module

Defines the XrayTwave class which inherits from the XrayLine class. Represents a line source’s Xray emissions, done so by placing multiple point-Lambertian sources along its length. And the sources are ignited by a travelling wave.

class core.xray_line_twave.XrayTwave(fwhm, line_length, rotation=0, n_samples_angular=400, n_samples=10, n_line_samples=10, wave_speed=1)[source]

Bases: XrayLine

Generates a line source by setting up an array of lambertian point sources which are ignited by a travelling wave. This class extends ‘Xrayline’

wave_speed

speed of the travelling wave igniting the xray source (natural units). Defaults to 1.

Type:

float, optional

Overridden Methods:
gen_xray_seed_line(azimuthal_angle: float) -> tuple[list, int(conditional)]:

Initializes the Xray coordinates by seeding each point source along the line and displacing their mean to for a travelling wave with a specified velocity.

gen_xray_seed_line(phi=0, get_total_samples=False) → tuple[source]

Generates xray coordinates for a line source generated by a travelling wave source

Returns:

A tuple containing

  • list: array of line-source-generated xray coordinates

  • int(conditional): the total number of xray points

Return type:

tuple[list, int]

get_wave_speed()[source]

Access method for wave_speed

Returns:

travelling wave velocity (c)

Return type:

float
